Description: A string composed of spherical, oblate, long truncated convex bicone and five lenticular beads, all of amethyst, and a single long truncated convex bicone bead of cornelian. One of the lenticular beads has a neck at both ends and both of its faces are engraved along the edges with four rough lines in a diamond shape. The other lenticular beads consist of one flattened standard convex bicone, two flattened ellipsoids and one flattened long truncated convex bicone.
Curator's comments: Cf. T. E. Peet & W. L S. Loat, ‘The Cemeteries of Abydos, part III. 1912-13 (London, 1913), pl. VIII, group 10: Middle Kingdom.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (490)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
